data.text: If a president can threaten one journalist for doing their job, they can threaten every journalist. Where do these violations of the First Amendment stop? We have to stand up, speak out, and keep calling out every attack on Americans’ rights. https://t.co/twBxgVAgQp

Kristi Noem is in Arizona today, but don’t get that confused with her doing her job. Under her leadership, ICE is creating chaos and making people less safe — including in Phoenix. Rosa Parks was born February 4, 1913, in Tuskegee, Alabama. She showed the world that courage doesn’t have to be loud to be powerful and that no matter where you were born, each of us has the power to change history and make the world a better place. https://t.co/yAaLoG8lDm

We had a hearing on what happens when the last major nuclear treaty between the U.S. and Russia expires this week. It's nothing good. Unfortunately, reducing nuclear risk doesn't seem to be a priority for this Administration. https://t.co/zFl7AdVeE3

I just left the court.

Today’s hearing was not just for my Constitutional rights, but for millions of retired veterans and all Americans. There is nothing more fundamental to our Democracy than the freedom to speak out about our government – that’s what I’m fighting for.

Every astronaut who’s walked on the Moon has trained in Flagstaff, and Arizona is proud of that legacy. I’m excited that now one of our own has a chance to be among the first people to step foot on the Moon in decades as a candidate for Artemis III. https://t.co/FAyntV1zwc

This Administration is going after peaceful protesters, journalists, veterans—me included. That’s unconstitutional. The First Amendment protects peaceful assembly, a free press, and every American’s right to speak up about their government. https://t.co/NqZsPqcxGF
